title-group.article-title: Reinventing the Shape of Meaning: Ambiguities in the Ontology of Ethnography

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1986 The Catholic University of America Press

abstract.p: Whose perspective is reflected in ethnographic accounts is the enduring problem in bringing ethnographic observation forward in the construction of ethnographies. Both ethnographic research and modes of account display a liminal character that puts this problem in a more organizational perspective on their heterogeneous authority and unites doing ethnography and constructing ethnographies in similar ontological ambiguities arising in the social organization of communication.
